Feature: Community Service and Accountability for Manager
  As a manager in the autonomous_entity system
  Operating at the community governance layer
  I want to serve community needs through workplace coordination
  So that ChickenMax functions as community institution, not extraction site

  Background:
    Given the Elohim Protocol is operational
    And Marcus coordinates ChickenMax operations serving community
    And the community governance context is active
    And community invested in EAE acquisition expecting community benefit

  Scenario: Manager coordinates community programs while workers govern priorities
    Given workers democratically decided to implement senior meal program
    And operational coordination is needed for program execution
    When Marcus coordinates senior meal program logistics
    Then Marcus ensures meals meet quality and dietary requirements
    And Marcus coordinates with senior center on scheduling and delivery
    And Marcus tracks program metrics (meals served, costs, feedback)
    But workers determine program scope, pricing, and continuation
    And community_elohim ensures program serves community without exploiting workers

  Scenario: Manager facilitates community stakeholder meetings transparently
    Given community investors and customers want to provide input
    And workers want community perspective while maintaining autonomy
    When annual stakeholder meeting occurs
    Then Marcus facilitates meeting ensuring all voices are heard
    And Marcus presents operational updates transparently
    And Marcus helps translate community input into actionable worker proposals
    But Marcus doesn't filter or control community input
    And workers make final decisions on community suggestions
    And community_elohim ensures facilitation doesn't manipulate outcomes

  Scenario: Manager responds to community concerns about operations
    Given community member complains about noise from early morning deliveries
    And legitimate community concern requires operational adjustment
    When Marcus receives the complaint
    Then Marcus investigates the noise issue objectively
    And Marcus proposes delivery schedule modification to worker council
    And workers deliberate balancing operational needs with community impact
    And workers vote on delivery schedule change
    And Marcus implements worker decision and communicates to community
    And community_elohim facilitates community-worker dialogue

  Scenario: Manager demonstrates ChickenMax democratic model to curious community
    Given community members are curious about worker ownership
    And Marcus has visible coordinator role in community institution
    When community members ask about democratic business model
    Then Marcus explains transformation from corporate extraction to worker ownership
    And Marcus emphasizes workers govern, he coordinates with their consent
    And Marcus's transparency about coordinator vs. owner role educates community
    And community sees democratic governance as viable alternative
    And other small businesses consider conversion after seeing example

  Scenario: Manager coordinates operations to serve community needs workers prioritize
    Given workers democratically decided to prioritize local sourcing
    And operational coordination is needed for supply chain transition
    When Marcus coordinates shift from Sysco to Johnson Farm
    Then Marcus manages logistics of local procurement
    And Marcus tracks quality, costs, and community feedback
    And Marcus ensures operational transition doesn't disrupt service
    And workers govern strategic decision, Marcus executes operationally
    And community benefits from local food system Marcus helps coordinate

  Scenario: Manager's community visibility shifts from corporate enforcer to democratic participant
    Given Marcus was previously invisible corporate manager
    And community only saw corporate brand, not individual manager
    When democratic conversion makes governance visible
    Then community knows Marcus as democratic coordinator, not owner or boss
    And community sees him at stakeholder meetings, farmers markets, neighborhood events
    And community recognizes him as community member serving institution
    And his role transformation from extraction to service becomes community narrative
    And community_elohim helps tell story of individual and structural transformation

  Scenario: Manager coordinates with community organizations for mutual benefit
    Given workers decided to partner with youth employment program
    And operational coordination is needed for internship program
    When Marcus coordinates youth internship logistics
    Then Marcus works with youth program on participant selection and scheduling
    And Marcus ensures youth interns receive quality training and mentorship
    And Marcus tracks program outcomes (skill development, employment, community impact)
    And Marcus reports to workers who govern program strategic decisions
    And community organization recognizes Marcus as reliable coordinator supporting youth

  Scenario: Manager ensures operational transparency builds community trust
    Given community wants to understand how democratic business actually functions
    And operational transparency is key to community confidence
    When Marcus prepares quarterly community report
    Then Marcus provides honest data on operations, challenges, and successes
    And Marcus doesn't hide operational difficulties or failures
    And Marcus celebrates worker governance achievements transparently
    And Marcus's operational honesty builds community trust in democratic model
    And community_elohim ensures reporting is accurate and accessible

  Scenario: Manager balances operational efficiency with community relationship priorities
    Given workers prioritize customer relationships over transaction speed
    And corporate model measured Marcus on speed metrics
    When Marcus coordinates daily operations
    Then Marcus optimizes for customer satisfaction and care, not just speed
    And Marcus measures success by community feedback and relationship depth
    And Marcus rejects corporate-style speedup pressure
    And operational coordination serves worker-defined values
    And community experiences genuine care, not performative corporate "service"

  Scenario: Manager participates in community economic development as practitioner
    Given municipality seeks input on economic development strategies
    And Marcus has practical experience with democratic business model
    When community economic development planning occurs
    Then Marcus shares operational insights about democratic coordination
    And Marcus explains how eliminating extraction enabled higher wages and community programs
    And Marcus advocates for policies supporting democratic business conversions
    And Marcus participates as community member with expertise, not as business representative
    And community_elohim connects his testimony to broader movement for economic democracy
